description: Deletes an Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP or Amazon FSx for OpenZFS volume.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: (Optional) An idempotency token for resource creation, in a string of up to 63 ASCII characters. This token is automatically filled on your behalf when you use the Command Line Interface (CLI) or an Amazon Web Services SDK. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: VolumeId
parameters.description: The ID of the volume that you are deleting.

parameters.name: OntapConfiguration
parameters.description: For Amazon FSx for ONTAP volumes, specify whether to take a final backup of the volume and apply tags to the backup. To apply tags to the backup, you must have the fsx:TagResource permission. SkipFinalBackup (boolean) --- Set to true if you want to skip taking a final backup of the volume you are deleting. FinalBackupTags (list) --- A list of Tag values, with a maximum of 50 elements. (dict) --- Specifies a key-value pair for a resource tag. A value that specifies the TagKey, the name of the tag. Tag keys must be unique for the resource to which they are attached. A value that specifies the TagValue, the value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key-value pair in a tag set of finances : April and also of payroll : April. BypassSnaplockEnterpriseRetention (boolean) --- Setting this to true allows a SnapLock administrator to delete an FSx for ONTAP SnapLock Enterprise volume with unexpired write once, read many (WORM) files. The IAM permission fsx:BypassSnaplockEnterpriseRetention is also required to delete SnapLock Enterprise volumes with unexpired WORM files. The default value is false. For more information, see Deleting a SnapLock volume.

nested_params.name: SkipFinalBackup
nested_params.description: Set to true if you want to skip taking a final backup of the volume you are deleting.

nested_params.name: FinalBackupTags
nested_params.description: A list of Tag values, with a maximum of 50 elements.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: A value that specifies the TagKey, the name of the tag. Tag keys must be unique for the resource to which they are attached.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A value that specifies the TagValue, the value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key-value pair in a tag set of finances : April and also of payroll : April.

nested_params.name: BypassSnaplockEnterpriseRetention
nested_params.description: Setting this to true allows a SnapLock administrator to delete an FSx for ONTAP SnapLock Enterprise volume with unexpired write once, read many (WORM) files. The IAM permission fsx:BypassSnaplockEnterpriseRetention is also required to delete SnapLock Enterprise volumes with unexpired WORM files. The default value is false. For more information, see Deleting a SnapLock volume.

parameters.name: OpenZFSConfiguration
parameters.description: For Amazon FSx for OpenZFS volumes, specify whether to delete all child volumes and snapshots. Options (list) --- To delete the volume's child volumes, snapshots, and clones, use the string DELETE_CHILD_VOLUMES_AND_SNAPSHOTS. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Options
nested_params.description: To delete the volume's child volumes, snapshots, and clones, use the string DELETE_CHILD_VOLUMES_AND_SNAPSHOTS.

nested_items.name: VolumeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the volume that's being deleted.

nested_items.name: Lifecycle
nested_items.description: The lifecycle state of the volume being deleted. If the DeleteVolume operation is successful, this value is DELETING.

nested_items.name: OntapResponse
nested_items.description: Returned after a DeleteVolume request, showing the status of the delete request.

nested_items.name: FinalBackupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the source backup. Specifies the backup that you are copying.

nested_items.name: FinalBackupTags
nested_items.description: A list of Tag values, with a maximum of 50 elements.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the TagKey, the name of the tag. Tag keys must be unique for the resource to which they are attached.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the TagValue, the value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key-value pair in a tag set of finances : April and also of payroll : April.
